text: Erigeron barbarensis is a rare Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It grows in southern Sonora and southwestern Chihuahua. Erigeron barbarensis is an annual herb up to 55 cm (22 inches) tall, producing a slender taproot. Each plant produces 3-8 flower heads per stem, with 32-48 white ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Nesom, Guy L. & Van Devender, Thomas Roger. 2007. Phytologia 89(2): 219–222 ==References== barbarensis Category:Flora of Mexico Category:Plants described in 2007
title: Erigeron barbarensis
